form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE Boston 7 Massachusetts., File: A 12 284 895 May 16, 1961

full_text: U S DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE Boston 7 Massachusetts. File: A 12 284 895 May 16 1961 MEMORANDUM Visa Petition submitted by SZETO GETMAN in behalf of his wife CHIN TAK HAN Service file A 12 000 421 relating to Petitioner shows that he filed petition for citizenship in the United States District Court at Boston, Massachusetts, on December 29 1960 and was admitted to citizenship by the same court on March 6 1961. Certificate of Naturalization 8205147 was issued to him. He alleged in his petition that he was born on October 24 1897 in Wang Que Now, Hoi Ping, China; that he married CHIN TAK HAN on March 19 1914, in the same village; that two children were born of their marriage - Choy Dun on September 22 1916 and Bow Kam, born February 14 1928, both born in Wang Que How, Hoi Ping, China; that since his admission to the United State S in August of 1921 he made two visits to China - he left Boston in September of 1926 and returned thereto in June of 1928, and he left Boston again in September of 1934 and returned thereto in June of 1935. This file shows that subject first arrived in the United States on August 19 1921 under the name of YEE NEE YON, claiming to be the son of year YOCK FONG, a native-born citizen of the United States. On the basis of his claim to citizenship Certificate of Identity 41428 was issued to him in the name of YEE NEE YON, on February 24 1922 at Boston, Massachusetts. Subject voluntarily appeared at this office on July 11 1960, at which time he stated he wished to make a statement under the Chinese Confession Program regarding his false claim to United States citizenship. He testified that his true name is SZETO GETMAN; that his true father's name was SZETO WOCK GEN; that he was a native and citizen of China; that he never resided in the United States. Subject now submits visa petition in behalf of his wife, who now resides at 23 A Ka Shin Street, 1st floor, Kowloon, Hong Kong. Photographs of subject and his wife are enclosed. It is recommended that this petition be approved. many Immi, grant Inspector
